00024 using std::string;
00025 
00027 const string host_url("localhost");
00028 const string user("root");
00029 const string pass("password");
00030 const string database("harix_db");
00031 
00032 
00033 static sql::ResultSet* commonResultSet;
00034 static sql::Connection* connector;
00035 static sql::Statement* stmt;
00036 
00037 inline void connectDatabase()
00038 {
00039   sql::Driver* driver = get_driver_instance();
00040   connector = driver->connect(host_url, user, pass);
00041   connector->setSchema(database);
00042   stmt = connector->createStatement();
00043 }
00044 
00045 inline void disconnectDatabase()
00046 {
00047   delete commonResultSet;
00048   delete stmt;
00049   delete connector;
00050 }

00055 
00065 std::vector<string> queryClassName(string class_code, string subclass_code, string progif_code)
00066 {
00067   std::vector<string> full_class_name;  // Hold Class, Subclass and Prog-if name.
00068   
00069   try{
00070     connectDatabase();
00071 
00072     // Make a call to the stored procedure which will return a line of corresponding names to the codes.
00073     // At least Class-Subclass code pair should exist in database for non-empty return.
00074     commonResultSet = stmt->executeQuery("CALL sp_queryClassName('"+ class_code +"','"+ subclass_code +"'," +
00075                                          "'" + progif_code  + "')");
00076 
00077     if( commonResultSet->next() ){
00078       full_class_name.push_back(commonResultSet->getString("className"));
00079       full_class_name.push_back(commonResultSet->getString("subclassName"));
00080       full_class_name.push_back(commonResultSet->getString("progifName"));
00081     }
00082     
00083   }
00084   catch (sql::SQLException &e) {
00085     /*
00086       The MySQL Connector/C++ throws three different exceptions:
00087       - sql::MethodNotImplementedException (derived from sql::SQLException)
00088       - sql::InvalidArgumentException (derived from sql::SQLException)
00089       - sql::SQLException (derived from std::runtime_error)
00090     */
00091     wApp->log("debug") << "# ERR: SQLException in " << __FILE__;
00092     wApp->log("debug") << "(" << __FUNCTION__ << ") on line " << __LINE__;
00093     /* Use what() (derived from std::runtime_error) to fetch the error message */
00094     wApp->log("debug") << "# ERR: " << e.what();
00095     wApp->log("debug") << " (MySQL error code: " << e.getErrorCode();
00096     wApp->log("debug") << ", SQLState: " << e.getSQLState() << " )";
00097 
00098   }
00099   disconnectDatabase();
00100 
00101   return full_class_name;
00102 }

00123

00127     // Make a call to the stored procedure which will return a line of corresponding names to the codes.
00128     // At least Vendor-Device code pair should exist in database for non-empty return.

00130                                          "'" + subvendor_code + "','" + subdevice_code + "')");
00131 
00132     if( commonResultSet->next() ){
00133       full_device_name.push_back(commonResultSet->getString("vendorName"));
00134       full_device_name.push_back(commonResultSet->getString("deviceName"));
00135       full_device_name.push_back(commonResultSet->getString("subsysName"));
00136     }
00137     
00138   }
00139   catch (sql::SQLException &e) {
00140     /*
00141       The MySQL Connector/C++ throws three different exceptions:
00142       - sql::MethodNotImplementedException (derived from sql::SQLException)

00153   disconnectDatabase();

00175 std::multimap<string, string>
00176 queryPcimapOsList(string vendor_code, string device_code, string subvendor_code, string subdevice_code,
00177                string class_code, string subclass_code, string progif_code)
00178 {
00179   std::multimap<string,string> ukernel_module_map; // ( unique_kernel_id, module_name_id )
00180   
00181   try{
00182     connectDatabase();
00183 
00184     // Make a call to the stored procedure which will return a list of OS-Module pairs that support the device.
00185     commonResultSet = stmt->executeQuery("CALL sp_queryPcimap('"+ vendor_code +"','"+ device_code +"'," +
00186                                          "'" + subvendor_code + "','" + subdevice_code + "'," +
00187                                          "'" + class_code + subclass_code + "','" + progif_code + "')");
00188 
00189     while( commonResultSet->next() ){
00190       ukernel_module_map.insert( std::pair<string,string>(commonResultSet->getString("uKernelID"), commonResultSet->getString("modNameID") ) );
00191     }
00192     
00193   }
00194   catch (sql::SQLException &e) {
00195     /*
00196       The MySQL Connector/C++ throws three different exceptions:
00197       - sql::MethodNotImplementedException (derived from sql::SQLException)
00198       - sql::InvalidArgumentException (derived from sql::SQLException)
00199       - sql::SQLException (derived from std::runtime_error)
00200     */
00201     wApp->log("debug") << "# ERR: SQLException in " << __FILE__;
00202     wApp->log("debug") << "(" << __FUNCTION__ << ") on line " << __LINE__;
00203     /* Use what() (derived from std::runtime_error) to fetch the error message */
00204     wApp->log("debug") << "# ERR: " << e.what();
00205     wApp->log("debug") << " (MySQL error code: " << e.getErrorCode();
00206     wApp->log("debug") << ", SQLState: " << e.getSQLState() << " )";
00207   }
00208   disconnectDatabase();
00209 
00210   return ukernel_module_map;
00211 }

00224 {

00233       full_os_details.push_back(commonResultSet->getString("osName"));

00235       full_os_details.push_back(commonResultSet->getString("kernelVersion"));
00236       full_os_details.push_back(commonResultSet->getString("machineHardware"));
00237     }
00238     
00239   }

00274 {

00278     connectDatabase();

00283                                          "AND machineHardware='"+ architecture  +"'");
00284

00286       ukernel_id = commonResultSet->getString("uKernelID");
00287     }
00288     
00289   }
00290   catch (sql::SQLException &e) {
00291     /*
00292       The MySQL Connector/C++ throws three different exceptions:
00293       - sql::MethodNotImplementedException (derived from sql::SQLException)

00299     /* Use what() (derived from std::runtime_error) to fetch the error message */

00301     wApp->log("debug") << " (MySQL error code: " << e.getErrorCode();
00302     wApp->log("debug") << ", SQLState: " << e.getSQLState() << " )";

00357 
00366 string recordOsInfo (OsInfo osInfo)
00367 {
00368   string osId_="", releaseId_="", uKernelId_="";
00369   try{
00370     connectDatabase();
00371     /*
00372      * Check OS Name entry in DB
00373      * @{
00374      */
00375     commonResultSet = stmt->executeQuery("SELECT osID FROM OSes WHERE osName='"+ osInfo.getDistro() +"'");
00376     
00377     if( commonResultSet->first() ){     // We alread have a distribution with that name.
00378       
00379       osId_ = commonResultSet->getString("osID");       // Return the osID from `OSes` table.
00380       
00381     }
00382     else{                               // Distribution with given OS name doesn't exist.
00383       
00384       // Insert Distribution into OSes.
00385       stmt->execute("INSERT INTO OSes(osName) VALUES ('"+ osInfo.getDistro() +"')");
00386 
00387       commonResultSet = stmt->executeQuery("SELECT LAST_INSERT_ID()");
00388       if( commonResultSet->next() ){
00389         osId_ = commonResultSet->getString(1);          // Return the currently inserted osID from `OSes` table.
00390       }
00391       
00392     }
00393     assert( osId_ != "" );
00394     /*
00395      * @}
00396      */
00397 
00398 
00399     /*
00400      * Check Release entry in DB
00401      * @{
00402      */
00403     commonResultSet = stmt->executeQuery("SELECT releaseID FROM os_releases WHERE osID_FK="+ osId_ +
00404                                          " AND releaseName='"+ osInfo.getRelease() +"'");
00405     
00406     if( commonResultSet->first() ){     // We alread have a distribution with given OS and Release names.
00407       
00408       releaseId_ = commonResultSet->getString("releaseID"); // Return the releaseID from `os_releases` table.
00409     }
00410     else{                               // Distribution with given Release name doesn't exist.
00411       
00412       // Insert Dist.Release into os_releases.
00413       stmt->execute("INSERT INTO os_releases(osID_FK,releaseName) VALUES("+ osId_ +",'"+ osInfo.getRelease() +"')");
00414       commonResultSet = stmt->executeQuery("SELECT LAST_INSERT_ID()");
00415       if( commonResultSet->next() ){
00416         // Return the currently inserted releaseID from `os_releases` table.
00417         releaseId_ = commonResultSet->getString(1);
00418       }
00419       
00420     }
00421     assert( releaseId_ != "" );
00422     /*
00423      * @}
00424      */
00425 
00426   
00427     /*
00428      * Insert uKernel entry in DB
00429      * @{
00430      */
00431     // Insert Kernel Version into kernels and retrieve uKernelID
00432     stmt->execute("INSERT INTO kernels( releaseID_FK, kernelVersion, machineHardware ) VALUES ("
00433                   + releaseId_ +",'"+ osInfo.getKernel() +"','"+ osInfo.getArch() +"')");
00434     commonResultSet = stmt->executeQuery("SELECT LAST_INSERT_ID()");
00435     if( commonResultSet->next() ){
00436       uKernelId_ = commonResultSet->getString(1);
00437     }
00438     /*
00439      * @}
00440      */
00441 
00442   }
00443   catch (sql::SQLException &e) {
00444     /*
00445       The MySQL Connector/C++ throws three different exceptions:
00446       - sql::MethodNotImplementedException (derived from sql::SQLException)
00447       - sql::InvalidArgumentException (derived from sql::SQLException)
00448       - sql::SQLException (derived from std::runtime_error)
00449     */
00450     wApp->log("debug") << "# ERR: SQLException in " << __FILE__;
00451     wApp->log("debug") << "(" << __FUNCTION__ << ") on line " << __LINE__;
00452     /* Use what() (derived from std::runtime_error) to fetch the error message */
00453     wApp->log("debug") << "# ERR: " << e.what();
00454     wApp->log("debug") << " (MySQL error code: " << e.getErrorCode();
00455     wApp->log("debug") << ", SQLState: " << e.getSQLState() << " )";
00456   }
00457   disconnectDatabase();
00458 
00459   assert( uKernelId_ != "" );
00460   return uKernelId_;
00461 }

00474 string checkModuleNameId( string module_name )
00475 {
00476   string mod_name_id;
00477   try{
00478     connectDatabase();
00479     commonResultSet = stmt->executeQuery("SELECT modNameID FROM module_names WHERE modName='"
00480                                          + module_name +"'");
00481     
00482     if( commonResultSet->first() ){         // If the given module name is already in database.
00483       
00484       mod_name_id = commonResultSet->getString("modNameID"); // Get it's ID.
00485       
00486     }
00487     else {                                  // If module name is not found, insert it..
00488       
00489       stmt->execute("INSERT INTO module_names(modName) VALUES ('"+ module_name +"')");
00490       
00491       commonResultSet = stmt->executeQuery("SELECT LAST_INSERT_ID()");
00492       if( commonResultSet->next() ){
00493         mod_name_id = commonResultSet->getString(1);        // And get it's ID.
00494       }
00495     }
00496   }
00497   catch (sql::SQLException &e) {
00498     /*
00499       The MySQL Connector/C++ throws three different exceptions:
00500       - sql::MethodNotImplementedException (derived from sql::SQLException)
00501       - sql::InvalidArgumentException (derived from sql::SQLException)
00502       - sql::SQLException (derived from std::runtime_error)
00503     */
00504     wApp->log("debug") << "# ERR: SQLException in " << __FILE__;
00505     wApp->log("debug") << "(" << __FUNCTION__ << ") on line " << __LINE__;
00506     /* Use what() (derived from std::runtime_error) to fetch the error message */
00507     wApp->log("debug") << "# ERR: " << e.what();
00508     wApp->log("debug") << " (MySQL error code: " << e.getErrorCode();
00509     wApp->log("debug") << ", SQLState: " << e.getSQLState() << " )";
00510   }
00511   disconnectDatabase();
00512   
00513   assert( mod_name_id != "" );
00514   return mod_name_id;
00515 }

00520 
00529 string checkKernelModule (string uKernelId, string modNameId)
00530 {
00531   string uniqueModuleId_="";
00532   try{
00533     connectDatabase();
00534     
00535     commonResultSet = stmt->executeQuery("SELECT uModID FROM modules WHERE uKernelID_FK="+ uKernelId +
00536                                          " AND modNameID_FK="+ modNameId);
00537     
00538     if( commonResultSet->first() ){             // We found the Module for the OS.
00539       uniqueModuleId_ = commonResultSet->getString("uModID");   // So get it's ID.
00540       
00541     }
00542     else {                                      // Module is not found for the OS, so insert a new record.
00543       stmt->execute("INSERT INTO modules(uKernelID_FK, modNameID_FK) VALUES ("+ uKernelId +","+ modNameId +")");
00544       
00545       commonResultSet = stmt->executeQuery("SELECT LAST_INSERT_ID()");
00546       if( commonResultSet->next() ){
00547         uniqueModuleId_ = commonResultSet->getString(1);        // Get it's ID, which is the last inserted one.
00548       }
00549     }
00550   }
00551   catch (sql::SQLException &e) {
00552     /*
00553       The MySQL Connector/C++ throws three different exceptions:
00554       - sql::MethodNotImplementedException (derived from sql::SQLException)
00555       - sql::InvalidArgumentException (derived from sql::SQLException)
00556       - sql::SQLException (derived from std::runtime_error)
00557     */
00558     wApp->log("debug") << "# ERR: SQLException in " << __FILE__;
00559     wApp->log("debug") << "(" << __FUNCTION__ << ") on line " << __LINE__;
00560     /* Use what() (derived from std::runtime_error) to fetch the error message */
00561     wApp->log("debug") << "# ERR: " << e.what();
00562     wApp->log("debug") << " (MySQL error code: " << e.getErrorCode();
00563     wApp->log("debug") << ", SQLState: " << e.getSQLState() << " )";
00564   }
00565   disconnectDatabase();
00566   
00567   assert( uniqueModuleId_ != "" );
00568   return uniqueModuleId_;
00569 }

00574 
00586 int insertPcimap ( const PciDevice* const currentPciDevice, std::string uniqueModuleId )
00587 {
00588   try{
00589     connectDatabase();
00590 
00591     // Select from the database `pcimap' table for pcimap-list entry of a specific Module of an OS.
00592     commonResultSet = stmt->executeQuery("SELECT * FROM pcimap WHERE uModID_FK="+ uniqueModuleId +
00593                                          " AND vendor='"+ currentPciDevice->getVendor() +"'"+
00594                                          " AND device='"+ currentPciDevice->getDevice() +"'"+
00595                                          " AND subvendor='"+ currentPciDevice->getSubvendor() +"'"+
00596                                          " AND subdevice='"+ currentPciDevice->getSubdevice() +"'"+
00597  " AND class='"+ currentPciDevice->getClass() + currentPciDevice->getSubclass() + currentPciDevice->getProgif() +"'"+
00598                                          " AND classMask='"+ currentPciDevice->getClassMask() +"'");
00599 
00600     if( !commonResultSet->first() ){            // The provided entry does not exist in pcimap-list so insert it.
00601       
00602       std::string insertPciEntry = 
00603         "INSERT INTO pcimap VALUES ("+ uniqueModuleId  +",'"+ currentPciDevice->getVendor() +"',"
00604         +"'"+ currentPciDevice->getDevice() +"','"+ currentPciDevice->getSubvendor() +"',"
00605         +"'"+ currentPciDevice->getSubdevice() +"',"
00606         +"'"+ currentPciDevice->getClass() + currentPciDevice->getSubclass() + currentPciDevice->getProgif() +"',"
00607         +"'"+ currentPciDevice->getClassMask() + "')";
00608       stmt->execute(insertPciEntry);
00609       // @TODO: check success of insertion with Statement -stmt- ; and put return
00610       
00611     }
00612     
00613   }
00614   catch (sql::SQLException &e) {
00615     /*
00616       The MySQL Connector/C++ throws three different exceptions:
00617       - sql::MethodNotImplementedException (derived from sql::SQLException)
00618       - sql::InvalidArgumentException (derived from sql::SQLException)
00619       - sql::SQLException (derived from std::runtime_error)
00620     */
00621     wApp->log("debug") << "# ERR: SQLException in " << __FILE__;
00622     wApp->log("debug") << "(" << __FUNCTION__ << ") on line " << __LINE__;
00623     /* Use what() (derived from std::runtime_error) to fetch the error message */
00624     wApp->log("debug") << "# ERR: " << e.what();
00625     wApp->log("debug") << " (MySQL error code: " << e.getErrorCode();
00626     wApp->log("debug") << ", SQLState: " << e.getSQLState() << " )";
00627     disconnectDatabase();
00628     return 1;
00629   }
00630   disconnectDatabase();
00631 
00632   return 0;
00633 }

00693 int deleteBoardModel( std::string board_id )
00694 {
00695   try{
00696     connectDatabase();
00697 
00698     // Delete board from `board_models' table, which will cascade into `dev_board' to delete it's devices.
00699     stmt->execute("DELETE FROM board_models WHERE boardID="+ board_id);
00700     commonResultSet = stmt->executeQuery("SELECT LAST_INSERT_ID()");
00701   }
00702   catch (sql::SQLException &e) {
00703     /*
00704       The MySQL Connector/C++ throws three different exceptions:
00705       - sql::MethodNotImplementedException (derived from sql::SQLException)
00706       - sql::InvalidArgumentException (derived from sql::SQLException)
00707       - sql::SQLException (derived from std::runtime_error)
00708     */
00709     wApp->log("debug") << "# ERR: SQLException in " << __FILE__;
00710     wApp->log("debug") << "(" << __FUNCTION__ << ") on line " << __LINE__;
00711     /* Use what() (derived from std::runtime_error) to fetch the error message */
00712     wApp->log("debug") << "# ERR: " << e.what();
00713     wApp->log("debug") << " (MySQL error code: " << e.getErrorCode();
00714     wApp->log("debug") << ", SQLState: " << e.getSQLState() << " )";
00715     return 1;
00716   }
00717   disconnectDatabase();
00718   return 0;
00719 }

00724 
00732 string insertBoardModel( string board_name )
00733 {
00734   string board_id;              // Hold the ID of the mainboard.
00735 
00736   try{
00737     connectDatabase();
00738 
00739     // Insert the given mainboard in database.
00740     stmt->execute("INSERT INTO board_models(boardName) VALUES ('"+ board_name +"')");
00741 
00742     // Retrieve the ID given at last insertion which is the currently inserted mainboard ID.
00743     commonResultSet = stmt->executeQuery("SELECT LAST_INSERT_ID()");
00744     if( commonResultSet->next() ){
00745       board_id = commonResultSet->getString(1);
00746     }
00747     
00748   }
00749   catch (sql::SQLException &e) {
00750     /*
00751       The MySQL Connector/C++ throws three different exceptions:
00752       - sql::MethodNotImplementedException (derived from sql::SQLException)
00753       - sql::InvalidArgumentException (derived from sql::SQLException)
00754       - sql::SQLException (derived from std::runtime_error)
00755     */
00756     wApp->log("debug") << "# ERR: SQLException in " << __FILE__;
00757     wApp->log("debug") << "(" << __FUNCTION__ << ") on line " << __LINE__;
00758     /* Use what() (derived from std::runtime_error) to fetch the error message */
00759     wApp->log("debug") << "# ERR: " << e.what();
00760     wApp->log("debug") << " (MySQL error code: " << e.getErrorCode();
00761     wApp->log("debug") << ", SQLState: " << e.getSQLState() << " )";
00762   }
00763   disconnectDatabase();
00764 
00765   return board_id;
00766 }

00778 void insertBoardDevices( string board_id, std::vector<string>& device_id_list )
00779 {
00780   try{
00781     connectDatabase();
00782 
00783     // Iterate through the list of devices and insert them in `dev_board' database table with given mainboard.
00784     std::vector<string>::iterator device_iter;
00785     for( device_iter = device_id_list.begin(); device_iter != device_id_list.end(); ++device_iter ){
00786       stmt->execute("INSERT INTO dev_board VALUES ("+ board_id +","+ *device_iter +")");
00787       commonResultSet = stmt->executeQuery("SELECT LAST_INSERT_ID()");
00788     }
00789     
00790   }
00791   catch (sql::SQLException &e) {
00792     /*
00793       The MySQL Connector/C++ throws three different exceptions:
00794       - sql::MethodNotImplementedException (derived from sql::SQLException)
00795       - sql::InvalidArgumentException (derived from sql::SQLException)
00796       - sql::SQLException (derived from std::runtime_error)
00797     */
00798     wApp->log("debug") << "# ERR: SQLException in " << __FILE__;
00799     wApp->log("debug") << "(" << __FUNCTION__ << ") on line " << __LINE__;
00800     /* Use what() (derived from std::runtime_error) to fetch the error message */
00801     wApp->log("debug") << "# ERR: " << e.what();
00802     wApp->log("debug") << " (MySQL error code: " << e.getErrorCode();
00803     wApp->log("debug") << ", SQLState: " << e.getSQLState() << " )";
00804   }
00805   disconnectDatabase();
00806     
00807 }

00819 string queryPciVendorName( string vendor_code )
00820 {
00821   string vendor_name="";        // Hold Vendor name.
00822   
00823   try{
00824     connectDatabase();
00825 
00826     // Make a call to the stored procedure which will return an entry of corresponding name to the code.
00827     commonResultSet = stmt->executeQuery("SELECT vendorName FROM pci_vendors WHERE vendorCode='"
00828                                          + vendor_code +"'");
00829 
00830     if( commonResultSet->next() ){
00831       vendor_name = commonResultSet->getString("vendorName");
00832     }
00833     
00834   }
00835   catch (sql::SQLException &e) {
00836     /*
00837       The MySQL Connector/C++ throws three different exceptions:
00838       - sql::MethodNotImplementedException (derived from sql::SQLException)
00839       - sql::InvalidArgumentException (derived from sql::SQLException)
00840       - sql::SQLException (derived from std::runtime_error)
00841     */
00842     wApp->log("debug") << "# ERR: SQLException in " << __FILE__;
00843     wApp->log("debug") << "(" << __FUNCTION__ << ") on line " << __LINE__;
00844     /* Use what() (derived from std::runtime_error) to fetch the error message */
00845     wApp->log("debug") << "# ERR: " << e.what();
00846     wApp->log("debug") << " (MySQL error code: " << e.getErrorCode();
00847     wApp->log("debug") << ", SQLState: " << e.getSQLState() << " )";
00848   }
00849   disconnectDatabase();
00850 
00851   return vendor_name;
00852   
00853 }

00880 string queryPciDeviceId( string vendor_code, string device_code ) // return deviceID from pci_devices
00881 {
00882   string device_id="";
00883   
00884   try{
00885     connectDatabase();

00888                                          + vendor_code +"' AND deviceCode='"+ device_code  +"'");
00889 
00890     if( commonResultSet->next() ){
00891       device_id = commonResultSet->getString("deviceID");
00892     }
00893     
00894   }
00895   catch (sql::SQLException &e) {
00896     /*
00897       The MySQL Connector/C++ throws three different exceptions:
00898       - sql::MethodNotImplementedException (derived from sql::SQLException)
00899       - sql::InvalidArgumentException (derived from sql::SQLException)

00901     */

00904     /* Use what() (derived from std::runtime_error) to fetch the error message */

00906     wApp->log("debug") << " (MySQL error code: " << e.getErrorCode();
00907     wApp->log("debug") << ", SQLState: " << e.getSQLState() << " )";

00924     if( commonResultSet->next() ){
00925       device_id = commonResultSet->getString(1);
00926     }
00927     
00928   }

00981 
00982 string insertUnknownPcisubId(string vendor_code, string device_code, string subvendor_code, string subdevice_code)
00983 {
00984   string deviceId, uPcisubId;
00985   if( queryPciVendorName( vendor_code ) == "" )
00986     insertPciVendor( vendor_code, "Unknown Vendor" ); // (vendor code, vendor name)
00987 
00988   if( (deviceId = queryPciDeviceId( vendor_code, device_code )) == "" ){
00989     wApp->log("debug") << "lets insert the new Device ID!!!";                                   // @test
00990     deviceId = insertPciDevice( vendor_code, device_code, "Unknown Device" ); // (vendor code, device code, name )
00991     wApp->log("debug") << "Unknown Device inserted with deviceId: "+ deviceId;                      // @test
00992   }
00993 
00994 
00995   // deviceID,subvendor,subdevice,subsysname
00996   uPcisubId = insertPciSubsys(deviceId, subvendor_code, subdevice_code, "Unknown");
00997 
00998   return uPcisubId;
00999 }

01198 string insertUnknownProgifId(string class_code, string subclass_code, string progif_code)
01199 {
01200   string subclassId, uProgifId;
01201   if( queryPciClassName( class_code ) == "" )
01202     insertPciClass( class_code, "Unknown" ); // (class code, classname)
01203 
01204   if( (subclassId = queryPciSubclassId( class_code, subclass_code )) == "" ){
01205     subclassId = insertPciSubclass(class_code, subclass_code, "Unknown" ); // (class code, subclass code, name )
01206   }
01207 
01208   uProgifId = insertPciProgif(subclassId, progif_code, "Unknown");
01209 
01210   return uProgifId;
01211 }

01250 
01252 
01261 string checkPciSpcId( const PciDevice* const currentPciDevice )
01262 {
01263   string pciSpcId;
01264 
01265   try{
01266     connectDatabase();
01267 
01268     // Select PCI special ID of provided device.
01269     commonResultSet = stmt->executeQuery("SELECT pciSpcID FROM pci_all WHERE "
01270                                          "vendorCode='"+ currentPciDevice->getVendor() + "' AND " +
01271                                          "deviceCode='"+ currentPciDevice->getDevice() + "' AND " +
01272                                          "subvendorCode='"+ currentPciDevice->getSubvendor() + "' AND " +
01273                                          "subdeviceCode='"+ currentPciDevice->getSubdevice() + "' AND " +
01274                                          "classCode='"+ currentPciDevice->getClass() + "' AND " +
01275                                          "subclassCode='"+ currentPciDevice->getSubclass() + "' AND " +
01276                                          "progifCode='"+ currentPciDevice->getProgif() + "'");
01277     if( commonResultSet->first() ){
01278       pciSpcId = commonResultSet->getString("pciSpcID");
01279     }
01280     else {                      // if device doesn't exist, insert it..
01281       stmt->execute("INSERT INTO pci_all"
01282                     "(vendorCode, deviceCode, subvendorCode, subdeviceCode, classCode,subclassCode,progifCode) "
01283                     "VALUES ('"+ currentPciDevice->getVendor() +"'," +
01284                     "'"+ currentPciDevice->getDevice() +"',"+
01285                     "'"+ currentPciDevice->getSubvendor() +"',"+
01286                     "'"+ currentPciDevice->getSubdevice() +"',"+
01287                     "'"+ currentPciDevice->getClass() +"',"+
01288                     "'"+ currentPciDevice->getSubclass() +"',"+
01289                     "'"+ currentPciDevice->getProgif() +"')");
01290 
01291       // Retrieve the ID given at last insertion which is the currently inserted PCI special ID.
01292       commonResultSet = stmt->executeQuery("SELECT LAST_INSERT_ID()");
01293       if( commonResultSet->next() ){
01294         pciSpcId = commonResultSet->getString(1);
01295       }
01296     }
01297   }
01298   catch (sql::SQLException &e) {
01299     /*
01300       The MySQL Connector/C++ throws three different exceptions:
01301       - sql::MethodNotImplementedException (derived from sql::SQLException)
01302       - sql::InvalidArgumentException (derived from sql::SQLException)
01303       - sql::SQLException (derived from std::runtime_error)
01304     */
01305     wApp->log("debug") << "# ERR: SQLException in " << __FILE__;
01306     wApp->log("debug") << "(" << __FUNCTION__ << ") on line " << __LINE__;
01307     /* Use what() (derived from std::runtime_error) to fetch the error message */
01308     wApp->log("debug") << "# ERR: " << e.what();
01309     wApp->log("debug") << " (MySQL error code: " << e.getErrorCode();
01310     wApp->log("debug") << ", SQLState: " << e.getSQLState() << " )";
01311   }
01312   disconnectDatabase();
01313 
01314   return pciSpcId;
01315 }

01318 
01320 
01333 string checkUniqueDeviceId( string dev_special_id, int bus_type = 1 )
01334 {
01335   string uDevId;                // Hold the unique device ID.
01336   std::stringstream ss;
01337   ss << bus_type;
01338   string type = ss.str();
01339 
01340   try{
01341     connectDatabase();
01342 
01343     // See what type of a bus is the device?
01344     switch (bus_type){
01345       
01346     case 1:                     // If it is a PCI device
01347       // See if it is already stored before.
01348       commonResultSet = stmt->executeQuery("SELECT uDevID FROM all_devices WHERE busTypeID_FK="+ type +
01349                                            " AND pciSpcID_FK="+ dev_special_id);
01350 
01351       if( commonResultSet->first() ){
01352         uDevId = commonResultSet->getString("uDevID");
01353       }
01354       else {                    // If the given PCI device doesn't exist in `all_devices' db table, add it..
01355         stmt->execute("INSERT INTO all_devices(busTypeID_FK,pciSpcID_FK) VALUES ("+ type +","+ dev_special_id+")");
01356         commonResultSet = stmt->executeQuery("SELECT LAST_INSERT_ID()");
01357         if( commonResultSet->next() ){
01358           uDevId = commonResultSet->getString(1);
01359         }
01360       }
01361       break;
01362       
01363       // case 2:                        // Might be for USB..
01364       // case 3:                        // Might be for PNP, whatever..
01365     }
01366 
01367   }
01368   catch (sql::SQLException &e) {
01369     /*
01370       The MySQL Connector/C++ throws three different exceptions:
01371       - sql::MethodNotImplementedException (derived from sql::SQLException)
01372       - sql::InvalidArgumentException (derived from sql::SQLException)
01373       - sql::SQLException (derived from std::runtime_error)
01374     */
01375     wApp->log("debug") << "# ERR: SQLException in " << __FILE__;
01376     wApp->log("debug") << "(" << __FUNCTION__ << ") on line " << __LINE__;
01377     /* Use what() (derived from std::runtime_error) to fetch the error message */
01378     wApp->log("debug") << "# ERR: " << e.what();
01379     wApp->log("debug") << " (MySQL error code: " << e.getErrorCode();
01380     wApp->log("debug") << ", SQLState: " << e.getSQLState() << " )";
01381   }
01382   disconnectDatabase();
01383   
01384   return uDevId;
01385 }

01396 getBoardList()
01397 {

01399

01405

01407       // Insert retrieved entries to mainboard_list.
01408       mainboard_list.insert( std::pair<string,string>( commonResultSet->getString("boardID"),
01409                                                        commonResultSet->getString("boardName") ) );
01410     }
01411 
01412   }
01413   catch (sql::SQLException &e) {

01443 std::vector<string> queryBoardDeviceList( string board_id )
01444 {
01445   std::vector<string> udev_id_list;             // Hold list of Unique Device IDs to be returned.
01446 
01447   try{
01448     connectDatabase();
01449     
01450     // Select from `dev_board' database table with provided mainboard ID.
01451     commonResultSet = stmt->executeQuery("SELECT uDevID_FK FROM dev_board WHERE boardID_FK="+ board_id );
01452 
01453     while( commonResultSet->next() ){           // Get list of unique device IDs.
01454       udev_id_list.push_back( commonResultSet->getString("uDevID_FK") );
01455     }
01456 
01457   }
01458   catch (sql::SQLException &e) {
01459     /*
01460       The MySQL Connector/C++ throws three different exceptions:
01461       - sql::MethodNotImplementedException (derived from sql::SQLException)
01462       - sql::InvalidArgumentException (derived from sql::SQLException)
01463       - sql::SQLException (derived from std::runtime_error)
01464     */
01465     wApp->log("debug") << "# ERR: SQLException in " << __FILE__;
01466     wApp->log("debug") << "(" << __FUNCTION__ << ") on line " << __LINE__;
01467     /* Use what() (derived from std::runtime_error) to fetch the error message */
01468     wApp->log("debug") << "# ERR: " << e.what();
01469     wApp->log("debug") << " (MySQL error code: " << e.getErrorCode();
01470     wApp->log("debug") << ", SQLState: " << e.getSQLState() << " )";
01471   }
01472   disconnectDatabase();
01473 
01474   return udev_id_list;
01475 }

01480 
01491 std::vector<string> queryDeviceCodes( string udev_id, int bus_type = 1 )
01492 {
01493   std::vector<string> device_codes;             // Hold hardware code list of a device to be returned.
01494 
01495   std::stringstream ss;
01496   ss << bus_type;
01497   string type = ss.str();
01498 
01499   try{
01500     connectDatabase();
01501 
01502     switch (bus_type){
01503     case 1:                     // if it is a PCI Device
01504       // Find the PCI special ID of the device.
01505       commonResultSet = stmt->executeQuery("SELECT pciSpcID_FK FROM all_devices WHERE uDevID="+ udev_id);
01506 
01507       if( commonResultSet->first() ){
01508         string pci_spc_id = commonResultSet->getString("pciSpcID_FK");
01509 
01510         // And retrieve it's hardware codes from `pci_all' database table.
01511         commonResultSet = stmt->executeQuery("SELECT * FROM pci_all WHERE pciSpcID="+ pci_spc_id );
01512         if( commonResultSet->next() ){
01513           device_codes.push_back( commonResultSet->getString("vendorCode") );
01514           device_codes.push_back( commonResultSet->getString("deviceCode") );
01515           device_codes.push_back( commonResultSet->getString("subvendorCode") );
01516           device_codes.push_back( commonResultSet->getString("subdeviceCode") );
01517           device_codes.push_back( commonResultSet->getString("classCode") );
01518           device_codes.push_back( commonResultSet->getString("subclassCode") );
01519           device_codes.push_back( commonResultSet->getString("progifCode") );
01520         }
01521       }
01522       break;
01523       // case 2:                        // Might be for USB..
01524       // case 3:                        // Might be for PNP, whatever..
01525     }
01526   }
01527   catch (sql::SQLException &e) {
01528     /*
01529       The MySQL Connector/C++ throws three different exceptions:
01530       - sql::MethodNotImplementedException (derived from sql::SQLException)
01531       - sql::InvalidArgumentException (derived from sql::SQLException)
01532       - sql::SQLException (derived from std::runtime_error)
01533     */
01534     wApp->log("debug") << "# ERR: SQLException in " << __FILE__;
01535     wApp->log("debug") << "(" << __FUNCTION__ << ") on line " << __LINE__;
01536     /* Use what() (derived from std::runtime_error) to fetch the error message */
01537     wApp->log("debug") << "# ERR: " << e.what();
01538     wApp->log("debug") << " (MySQL error code: " << e.getErrorCode();
01539     wApp->log("debug") << ", SQLState: " << e.getSQLState() << " )";
01540   }
01541   disconnectDatabase();
01542 
01543   return device_codes;
01544 }

01648 std::multimap<std::string,std::string>
01649 queryReleaseKernels( std::string release_id )
01650 {
01651   std::multimap<string,string> kernel_list;     // Hold list of Kernels(uKernelID, kernelVersion-machineHardware)
01652 
01653   try{
01654     connectDatabase();
01655 
01656     // Select entries from the `kernels' table which belong to the Release with release_id ID.
01657     commonResultSet = stmt->executeQuery("SELECT * FROM kernels WHERE releaseID_FK="+ release_id );
01658 
01659     while( commonResultSet->next() ){
01660       // Insert retrieved entries into kernel_list. Put Kernel Version and it's architecture together.
01661       kernel_list.insert( std::pair<string,string>( commonResultSet->getString("uKernelID"),
01662                                                     commonResultSet->getString("kernelVersion") +
01663                                                     "-" + commonResultSet->getString("machineHardware") ) );
01664     }
01665 
01666   }
01667   catch (sql::SQLException &e) {
01668     /*
01669       The MySQL Connector/C++ throws three different exceptions:
01670       - sql::MethodNotImplementedException (derived from sql::SQLException)
01671       - sql::InvalidArgumentException (derived from sql::SQLException)
01672       - sql::SQLException (derived from std::runtime_error)
01673     */
01674     wApp->log("debug") << "# ERR: SQLException in " << __FILE__;
01675     wApp->log("debug") << "(" << __FUNCTION__ << ") on line " << __LINE__;
01676     /* Use what() (derived from std::runtime_error) to fetch the error message */
01677     wApp->log("debug") << "# ERR: " << e.what();
01678     wApp->log("debug") << " (MySQL error code: " << e.getErrorCode();
01679     wApp->log("debug") << ", SQLState: " << e.getSQLState() << " )";
01680   }
01681   disconnectDatabase();
01682   
01683   return kernel_list;
01684   
01685 }
